intro: Viola odorata proles austriaca, commonly known as the Austrian violet, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped, velvety leaves and clusters of fragrant, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers moist, well-drained soils in partial shade. It blooms from late spring to early summer, producing showy flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. This species is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been cultivated for centuries in gardens across Europe.
